Autoscan did a great job of this, and lets me reorganize the books within each to play by the proper order. This is one of my favorite features in MortPlayer, and I'm very happy to see it here.   Chapter skip takes me to the next book... for me this is OK, since I don't have chapter marks in many of them (most are home-made). I imagine this is to function for MP3 books which often have chapters as individual files, mine have been joined into m4b files. Would be great if I could somehow differentiate between chapters in an m4b and files within a book series. Alternately, a feature for multiple play lists could replace this.  To find my place (say if I fall asleep) requires me to move forward or back in one minute increments, which is much too tedious. Any other media player I've seen has a dragable slider on the progress bar to let you move quickly...    Authors comments fixed issues. Long press is ~5 sec.
replyContent: The library scans for books via folders. Multiple books in the same folder are seen as a single book. Choose 'split book' in library to move books into subfolders. Long press the progress bar to enable dragging.  Use history in action bar to jump back the next morning after using sleep timer.  Email for any followup questions.  -jared
